availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Caleb Wallace Logan (Jefferson County, KY, attorney & judge)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney and judge. Shelby County, Kentucky native. Married to Agatha Logan. Father of Priscilla Logan, Myra Logan, Agatha Logan, Mary Logan, and Lizzie Logan. Studied law with George Bibb. Attorney in Louisville in 1850. Attorney in Louisville in 1860. Judge of the Louisville Chancery Court in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 2, p. 232A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville 4th Ward, p. 60.
"Caleb Wallace Logan (1819-1864)," Find A Grave, Memorial #72269518, accessed July, 26, 2017, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/72269518/.
“The Late Judge Caleb W. Logan,” Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, KY), November 29, 1867, p. 2.
